dtResponses.response: Ehh?
I am sorry but I did not understand thee.
My Lady, thy speech is too eloquent for me.
My Lord, please speak in words my simple ears can understand.
So, what now?
Huh. How about that.
Me mum found a cat today.
*looks confused*
*blank stare*
Dost thou think it will rain?
I don't know.
Art thou talking to me?
I was just thinkn about goin to the pub and havin meself a nice warm beer.
What were we talking about?
Maybe it's time to take some action.
My name is {0}.
{0} is my name, and thine?
My name is my own. Call me what thou will.
You can call me {0}.
Good to meet you.
Ah! {1}, a woman of renown I am sure!
{1}, a strong name worthy of one such as thee.
May the Virtues keep thee.
*nods*
*grunts*
*waves*
Hello
Hail and well met!
*gasp*
*laughs* Thou knowest me not?
Farewell {1}!
Fare thee well m'lord!
Fare thee well m'lady!
Farewell my lord. Blessings upon you!
Hail m'lady!
Hail m'lord!
Hello there!
A pleasure to meet thee {1}.
{1}, ah such a beautiful name for such a beautiful woman!
{1}, such a strong name!
Who art thou who requires my name?
Waste not my time any longer.
Why it's {0}, thine eyes have dimmed, my friend!
May the Virtues guide thee m'lady.
Sod off!
Goodbye
Well met!
Greetings!
{1} fine, so thou shall be known.
*looks startled*
Do you know Tristam from Moonglow? I don't much like the look of those dogs of his. Look like they might have some hellhound blood in them.
*hic* did you know *hic* in the future *hic* theres gonna be *hic* these flying boats *hic*
Theres something funny about Renaldo and Heath. They both served in the Royal Navy for three years, when they got back, they bought a house together on Verity Isle.
Marianna has been hoarding reagents for longer than I can remember, Not quite sure when she's expecting the world to end, but I imagine if it doesn't she could open up a reagent shop and retire.
*hic* rumors? *hic* yeah a few I know *hic* oh hang on--
Rumors? I have better things to do than gossip all my time away, and so do you. Now kindly take your leave.
Rumors? Nay Sir, I'm not privy to such things
Rumors? No, My Good Lady, I haven't heard anything worth telling.
Sure I've heard a few rumors, Have you heard the one about what happened to the annoying bloke who wouldn't leave me alone?
There's something not quite right about Kendrick. He was just never the same person after he came back from Serpent's Isle. Touched in the head maybe.
I hear weird noises coming from Edmunds house at night. Not quite sure what he's up to. Funny character if you ask me...
I wouldn't trust anyone delving in the art of necromancy. Something's just unsettling about the whole subject if you ask me.
Strange ships have been coming in to port in the dead of night. Not sure what they be carrying, but the dockworkers are pretty hush about it if you ask them.
People say Gaston used to be a brigand, but I don't believe he's ever hurt a soul
I probably shouldn't tell you this, but Dominic, Captain of the Night Watch, has been known to pilfer coin from unsuspecting people.
I feel sorry for Sarah, her Ma passed away, and ever since her Father's been a useless lout, always drinking, never working, the poor girls having to feed the both of them on her own.
Maurita is a very handsome woman, I envy her husband
I hear shouting all the time at the Bennett's house. Oh how I do pity that poor woman being married to that imbecile.
Clement dissapears often for long periods of time. Wonder hat he's up too. Not entirely bright, that one, I hope he's not mixed up in anything.
Nash and Sarah seem to have seperated. Good thing, if you ask me, He was way too good for her
Sure I know Rumor or two. Don't look like I'd tell them to the likes of you, now does it?
I'm a Tailor by trade. I make all the gold while me husband drinks it away in the tavern.
What I do ain't none of thy business. Now leave me be.

I'm a Farrier, though I'm taking a bit of a break right about now. Got a nasty kick a while back, Me wife healed it as best she could, but it weren't a very strong potion, reagents aren't exactly cheap on my salary.
I'm a Thief. Now leave me to my lonesome, lest you wish your possesions to cease being yours.
Why I'm a fortune teller. I see thee being injured very soon if thou dost not take thy leave.
I'm a Craftsman of sorts. Leather, light metal work, pottery, mostly decorative stuff. Alot of people say its a soft job, but why spend my life making the same curiasses day after day?
I'm a Royal Gardener, I tend after the plants in Lord British' Castle Courtyard. It's a very prestigous job, I'll have you know.
I'm a Blacksmith, me guilds on strike now, so I'm on a bit of an involuntary vacation.
I'm a Mercenary, but I haven't had much luck finding work of late. Too much damn peace in the world for my tastes.
I'm a Courier, If your guilds got messages it needs sent fast and discreetly, I'm the man for the job!
I'm a Courier, If your guild has got messages it needs sent fast and discreetly, I'm the girl for the job!
I really don't like to get into specifics before receiving payment *winks*
I'm an Artist, I'd offer to paint a portrait of you, but I doubt the canvas could take the agony.
My dear woman, you have a face so beautiful, that my skills as an Artist would do it little justice.
I'm an Apprecentice Mage on assignment from the Council in Magincia. Have you thought of joining the Council? It's fascinating work, really.
I wasn't aware that what I did for a living was any of thy business.
What do I do for a living? I avoid answering questions from complete strangers. Now kindly take your leave before I hex you something fierce.
I'm a Monk from Empath Abbey, its an easy enough life, once you get over the vow of chasity.
I'm just a Farmer, I was in the Royal Navy before, but me Pa died and left me a bit o' land, so I decided to put it to good use.
Me, I'm an Alchemist. It's decent coin, and I've only lost a few fingers
I'm a Bard at the Royal Conservatory
I'm a Carpenter, its an easy enough trade for someone who likes working with their hands.
I'm a Blacksmith, my dear lady.
I'm a Soldier, and I Apologize but I must take my leave. Good Day Citizen.
I'm a Seamstress, and I have a wedding to do, excuse me.
I'm a Shipwright, sorry I don't take orders from citizens, I have my hands busy with military contracts at the moment.
I'm the Royal Librarian, sorry too busy to talk
I'm an Alchemist, and I'm very busy. Good Day
I'm a Blacksmith, my good sir
I'm a Monk, if you'll excuse me I'll get back to my medititation
*looks at the sun*
*looks at the moon*
It is early yet
Why, it is afternoon...
Evening time it is! Where's the pub?
It is too late to be about I'm afraid!
All I know m'lord, is the sun is out
All I know m'lady, is the sun is out
Daytime, and a glorious day it is!
Daytime, that's all I know.
It is past time for us to be about!
OOOhhh.. what thou going to buy?
Big spender here!
I bought something that broke from him once... careful
I wish i could get that.....
Spare a gold coin, sir?
What art thou looking for?
The vendor in britain is cheaper thou knowest...
He's peddling broken wares!
Art thou talking to me?
I'd buy you if i could....
Psst!....
If that is what thou desire, check the dungeons.
Where hast thou looked?
I can tell thee where thou canst look for that....
Oh? Try asking thy mother!
Dost thou know who found one? Thy mum!
What am I, a runner boy?
Hmm let me think... where have I seen that...
Who lost that????
Is that the case?!
Where didst thou loose it?
Sir, keep better track of thine belongings!
I heard someone found that a few days ago.....
Hast thou examined the dungeon thou wert in just before???
*laughs* thou art really a doofus, sir
Good day, My Son
Have thee stopped by for a blessing?
Yes... I can see thy soul needs rest.
Now, tell me what thou hast done.
Absolution requires a donation.
Tell me of thine sins.
The Gods are merciful, for those who pay.
Yes, have a seat, my son
I am here for thy redemption... go on.
Hast thou Donated today, My Son?
Only the generous will obtain true redemption.
Alas, we are running out of supplies for the needy....
Yes, let me Bless you....
Thou art not in need of a blessing today, go forth!
Simply put some gold on the floor here...
Please donate 10 gold to a farmer in need... only then willt thou receive thy Blessing from the Gods.
Please donate 100 gold to a Beggar in need... only then wilt thou receive thy Blessing from the Gods.
Please donate 500 gold to a Beggar in need... only then wilt thou receive thy Blessing from the Gods.
Please donate 200 gold to a Beggar in need... only then wilt thou receive thy Blessing from the Gods.
Please donate 100 gold to a farmer in need... only then wilt thou receive thy Blessing from the Gods.
Please donate 200 gold to a farmer in need... only then wilt thou receive thy Blessing from the Gods.
Please donate some bread for the needy...
Only the faithful may donate... repent thy sins first!
Thank thee for donating, thou mayest put it on the floor here. Now tell me of thine problems...
I have taken thy gold, I thank thee.
My son... this was not adviseable...
Why didst thee choose to take the path of destruction?
You must repent these actions, My Son!
Thank thee for ridding the world of these evil dwellers
I did this too, when my soul was lost in the depths of perdition... come back to the virtues my son
There is no redemption in seeking gold thus.
Please, take on Carpentry instead of these devilish actions!
Dungeons are for wimps
I did worse with my eyes closed
That's nothing, pfff.
I don't believe thee at all
What proof have thou?? ?
Oh? Then what happened?
... wow... and?
Didst thou find anything worthy?
Didst thou find... a LICH?
How did you kill this fiend?
What weapon didst thou use???
Didst thou find any treasures??
That's quite a find
Can thee spare a bit of that?
Pfft. I have better.
Thou shouldst donate some of that to the local priest... for the poor like me'self
How much gold is that worth?
Thou found my gold! Please give it back!
Art thou going back to get more?
Wow... when i went I didn't see that...
I can't beleive that was just sitting there!
Show me!
How often dost thee go hunting?
*whistles*
That's a nice find
Didst thou find that in {2}?
Remember poor old {0} in thy success... sir
Art thou a magician?
Canst thou make some food for me and my 5 children?
What's your favorite spell?
I heard of a book that can hold all thy spells, but I have never seen one.
Pfft. Magicians have all the glory. Us l'il folk have to make due with what we have
I hate magicians.
Please continue to protect the lands m'lord
I want one too - thou shalt let me know if thee find one?
Sir, Mayest I know how thou didst that?
Child's play... try necromancy!
Canst thou put a spell... on me? *wink*
Thou canst sell that here in {2}...
Is not that store closed?
This is {2}.
This is {2}, and I am {0}. Does that help?
Art thou really so dim? This is {2}, fool!
Deides? I've heard of him...
Deides is the one who created this world, long ago. A being of mystical insights. There is one bearing his name in Ambrosia today.
Deides the mighty warrior, Blessed be his memory!
It has been a while since I spoke to Deides.
I played dice with Deides once!
Hah! I won't follow thee!
No, I refuse to come with thee!
Thou mistaketh me for thy pet.
Pfft, I'm not going anywhere.
Hey! Thou canst not leave thy pet here!
And who will look after it???
Take away thy pet!
*waits for a chance to steal the pet*
The Gods are mysterious... Mysterious indeed...
I've never seen such evil... never before
Money... always need money for the poor... what problems we have...
Good day My Son, come to pray?
There are many evils in the lands... help us destroy them
I do not know of a God of Nature.. is that not odd?
Druids art our brethren... though we walk different paths.
Yes... though I disagree with the violence... it is necessary sometimes...
For every ill there is a cure...
I am father {0}, my son.
I am a servant of the Virtues, I am known as {0}
My son, they call me {0}, though many call me "father".
Deides may be in the pantheon of the gods - who knows...
I often pray to Deides, though he does not answer.
No {1}, I won't follow thee. I am happy in {2}.
I don't take orders from thee, sire.
And where art thou going?
Alas, my life must be spent here, praying to the virtues
Alas, 'tis not the right time: I am needed here in {2}.
Yes, we all want these things, but these are needs of the flesh. seek solace for thine soul and thou willt find true happiness.
Many in {2} have these wants as well, I am here for thee my son.
Though thou mayst want that - reflect further and thou mayst find that thee need it not.
Thee want, I want, we all want... *hums*
Well... I want a baby Dragon for my birthday and that won't happen now will it?
My son, please donate to the needy.
Think of those in need, {1}.
Yes, those are nice, mightest thou consider a donation?
Good to meet you {2}, how may I be of assistance?
Good to meet you {2}, what art thou up to?
Yes, find a priest and go donate some of that wealth
T'would be a lovely thing to do...
Thou canst donate that to me... I'll take it.
I donated yesterday, that's the truth!
Thou art in the local temple, My Son
Oh, this is {2}. Art thou a new arrival?
This is a holy site, home to the teachings of purity and light!
What? This is {2} of course.
Thou speakest to me?
I am a wizard, my dear {1}, a weaver of spells.
I, my dear {1}, am a master of the arcane.
I am {0}, mage extraordinaire!

Relivinian was a mage driven mad by the Daemons he attempted to control. He became so afraid that others were attempting to steal his research that he fled Britain and drew upon his powers to create a magical maze pulled from all areas of the world to protect himself from watchful eyes.
Relvinian is an elf-spawn from the old days of Britannia before the coming of Exodus. He grew in power soon after the destruction of Exodus, but vanished mysteriously ages ago.
It is said that Relvinian's goal was to summon Daemons to serve as slaves to the people of Britannia. As thou might suspect, his foolish venture went gravely wrong.
I've heard Relvinian's maze contains naught but mages now.
Rumor has it that Relvinian's maze contains the power to heal those wounded in battle.
It is said that somewhere in Relvinian's maze is the power to summon daemons, but I would not bet my life on it."
I wish I wert more skilled....
I know nothing about this person...
I may grudgingly help thee learn a few things. I would prefer that thou didst leave me alone, but I can teach thee a bit, if thou dost need it.
I'd wish for thee to leave me be. But if thou dost need, I could teach thee some of what I know.
Please, I ask thee to just leave me alone. I have little time for thee.
I may grudgingly help thee learn a few things. I would If thou dost want to learn, I might be persuaded to teach thee some of the arcane arts. Thou wouldst certainly need to pay me, of course.
Thou shouldst know something about the magical arts. 'Twould help thee greatly. I could be of some assistance, I think.
Well met!
What art thou doing now?
How may I be of service?
Blessings on thee, My Son
You stink!
I've seen better looking adventurers...
I want to be a warrior like thee one day...
Beautiful armour thou havest, sir!
Yes M'lord, thou canst get blessed at the local abbey.
I'm a vagrant... I do bits and pieces when I can, M'lord
I heard there's a maze with Minotaurs that drop slayer deeds!
Oh no! It's time for me to go back to me wife... hah she can Waite, that Hag!
Is that really a name from where thou came??
Well I never!
Pff... I won't talk to thee either then.
Sir, my apologies.
It's good to talk and enlighten your soul, child!
Of course, M'lord.
Pardon me, I thought thou wert speaking to me.
Well then move along!
Well you ARE close to me, sire.
And may you rot in hades!
Well, I NEVER!
I can't believe you said that!
You are quite the Abydocomist! Did you mother raise you that way?
Well tho Bespawls in thine sleep!
And Tho Arest a Bobolyne! Go on, me thinkest tho not knowest what that is.
And you are a filthy Cumberworld M'lord
You're a dorbel dew-beater and a drate-poke!
FopDoodle, Fustylugs!
've seen Gnashgab's with more sense than you!
And fuck thou as well, Sire
What is that word thou issueth forth in my presence?!
You're a GNASHGAB: An 18th century northern English word for someone who only ever seems to complain.
And you're a GOBERMOUCH: An old Irish word for a nosy, prying person who likes to interfere in other people’s business.

And you're a LUBBERWORT: In the 16th century, lubberwort was the name of an imaginary plant that was supposed to cause sluggishness or stupidity, and ultimately came to be used as a nickname for a lethargic, fuzzy-minded person.
And you're a MUCK-SPOUT: A dialect word for someone who not only talks a lot, but who seems to constantly swear.
And you're a MUMBLECRUST: Derived from the name of a stock character in medieval theatrical farces, a mumblecrust is a toothless beggar.
And you're a RAGGABRASH: A disorganized or grubby person.
And you're a ROIDERBANKS: Someone who lives beyond their means, or seems to spend extravagantly.
And you're a SADDLE-GOOSE: Someone who wastes their time in fruitless acts!
And you're a SCOBBERLOTCHER: someone who never works hard.
And you're a SKELPIE-LIMMER: A badly-behaved child.
And you're a SMELLFUNGUS: someone who always finds fault in the places they visit.
And you're a SNOUTBAND: Someone who constantly interrupts a conversation, typically only to contradict or correct someone else.
And you're a STAMPCRAB: A heavy-footed, clumsy person.
And you're a STYMPHALIST: Someone who smells very bad.
And you're a TALLOWCATCH: literally “a barrel of fat.”
And you're a TRIPTAKER: A finicky, fault-finding pedant.
And you're a WANDOUGHT: Wandoughty is an old word for impotence.
And you're a WHIFFLE-WHAFFLE: An indecisive, time-wasting ditherer.
And you're a YALDSON: A 15th century word literally meaning “the son of a prostitute.”
And you're a ZOILIST: an overly-critical and judgmental nitpicker.
I was here first M'lord.
I would if I could!
And thou thinkest I can just take leave of my spot like that?
Hah! Were only that I was able to!
I fart in thy direction, "M'lord"!
Sire, I don't want to leave you...
Thou insolent Danderpus!
Thou Stinkest more than Myles!
How dare thee insult me!
I do not know what thou art talking about!

My Son, the crypts under this abbey are ancient, and many evils lie within, thou mayest be able to help us rid the world of these evils... yes.. we have sealed the entrance and only those who speak the word "malefactum" may enter.
Sorry? I don't know about this doom...
Are we doomed??? Oh no

My Son, the crypts under this abbey are ancient, and many evils lie within, thou mayest be able to help us rid the world of these evils... yes.. we have sealed the entrance and only those who speak the proper code may enter.
A code? I'm not sure, sorry
Yes... I shall give thee the code, for a price - I will take all gold in thine pack as a donation. The code is "malefactum". Fare thee well my son, blessed thou art for thy bravery.
I wouldst give thee this code, but thou lackest the gold for a donation. Come back with a donation that is worthy of this task.
Yeah... this one is a little off... he always says he does things because of his dumbness... not sure what'e means really.
I hear the animal trainer can find your pets if thou asketh him to fetch them for thee.
I hear the veterinarian can find thy pets if thou wert to ask him find them for thee.
Aye, the animal trainers can "find" or "fetch" thy pets for thee, friend.
Go talk to someone who cares... maychance that trainer at the stables. Perhaps he can find them...
Aye... there are thieves around, or so I hear.
I hear any thief can be caught by using both hands (double clicking) on them.
Aye... there are thieves around, or so I hear.
Thieves who have stolen from a player are vulnerable to being caught... at least until they visit the thief guildmaster.
Thieves can be caught anywhere in the world... even in the bank!
Yes sir, I wish I could win one day
Tickets are too expensive for me! They are 1,000 gold!
I am told adventurers can type [lottery to get the latest inforamtion on the lottery... I haven't the faintest idea what that means though...
I know someone who won once!!! Havest thou bought any tickets?
Everything in this world will remain where thou hast placed it... unless someone steals it!
The Time Lord... a mighty being indeed!
The time lord is where thou canst pledge for the balance! Which side willst thou choose?
I hear the time lord can give special gifts to those who pledge to the balance.
Take care in the night's darkness!
Take care in the night's darkness!
I hope thou art swallowed up by the darkness!
I hope thou art swallowed up by the darkness!
Farewell
*nods*
Thou art not of my flock, but I shall bless thee anyhow...
In my father's father's time we used whole logs for our crafts. Now we mill them to perfect boards first.
Thou shouldst seek thee out a sawmill to work thy logs into boards for thine craft.
Logs are useless to the modern carpenter: Look for the large saws in carpenter shops: they allow all to use them for free.
Most everyone has a skill, if it's a trade you wish to learn, speak to those most skiled like a guildmaster or a vendor.
Players have been known to train skills, even to level of mastery... for an extraordinary fee! Just look for them when they aren't too busy: at a tavern or bank.
Don't wait too long between asking for training and dropping the gold in their hands, else they may move on to other business and see your offer as a donation!
It is said that intelligence alone is enough to command more creatures: mayhaps thou shouldst work on thy mind?
I have heard that a master of animal herding can command an extra animal more than most.
I've heard of some kind of rare magical enchantments which can bestow additional command over creatures, but I've never met anyone with one...
Oh my! Guards!
Someone do something!
Reaping what you've sown, {1}?
Oh no... I hope I don't have to get involved...
Creatures and people alike seem to find themselves naturally at ease near one who is master of healing animals, perhaps that would aid thee as well?
Maybe if you were a master of herding you'd find it easier?
Perchance if thou wert a master of herding thou wouldst find it easier?
Ahhh! To command many requires a powerful mind: train thy intellect and thou shalt have no toruble!
'Tis simple: learn a trade and aid the local vendors by supplying them with more goods to sell.
Why not learn a trade? I hear there are those who will buy colored ingots and other rare resources in the bank.
There are many trees with many fruits to harvest: all thou needest is any sharp blade. Sell these to the farmers and cooks of the land.
Thou canst shear sheep and spin their wool. The yarn canst be made into valuable bolts of cloth on any loom.
Havest thou considered the hunt? Thou canst collect leathers to sell or use thyself for thine own crafts, as well as meats and other products which can be sold to the butcher.
'Tis a simple life, but hunting and foraging for fruits and nuts in the trees can bring in enough gold to keep thee going.
Havest thou a weapon? The taverns are oft filled with adventurers who boast of treasures liberated from crypts, graveyards, and deep dungeons.
Thou shouldst inquire at the tavern: there are many boards with jobs posted that need doing!
Hmm...I am not certain...
I do not know, but I overheard some adventurers in Yew speaking of this this location.
Perinian Depths? Dangerous place. The entrance is in the North East of Sosaria.
Even if I knew, I wouldn't tell ye...begone.
Hah! Ye look far too puny for a place like Time Awaits.
Time Awaits would chew you up and spit you out. My advice? Try besting a goat, first!
Time Awaits, eh? Sosaria, friend. A ways southeast of Britain.You'll need a boat.
I am busy, please go bother someone else.
Time Awaits? Hmm...I know it is in Sosaria to be sure...Perhaps south of Britain?
Dungeon Clues? Haven't a clue! Hah!
Oh...Dungeon Clues...I lost an eye in that gods forsaken place. If you must know, it is in Sosaria.
A pretty lady like you in Clues? I could...escort you...*wink wink*
Dungeon Clues is on an Island in eastern Sosaria. The moongate system can take you there. Be safe!
Cold Halld? I think I remember hearing that it can be found near Glacial Coast.
That place is cursed! Do not go there!
Fires of Hell is in Sosaria. The entrance is in the mountains south of Britain.
Fires of Hell? You know my wife?
Fires of Hell...I heard some adventurers in Montor speaking of this place...but I do not know.
Fires of Hell? That's the nickname the Wench gave me after I raised HER strength! Hahaha!
Dardin's Pit is about a day's travel north of the city of Britain.
Dardin's Pit? Never heard of it.
I think Dardin's Pit is north of Britain in Sosaria.
The Ancient Pyramid is in Sosaria. There is a desert in the northwest. Look there.
Ancient what? What's a pyra...*hic*
The Ancient Pyramid? Sosaria, methinks.
Come a little closer and I'll show you an Ancient Pyramid!
The Mines of Morinia are in the mountains of western Sosaria. South of Moon.
Those mines are dangerous! West of Devil Guard. Be careful if you venture into their depths.
Mines of Morinia? Is that the wench in Britain? *hic*
Abandon? It's entrance lies in Sosaria. The peninsula west of Montor.
Abandon...Abandon....sounds familiar but I cannot quite think of the location...
Bother someone else ye lout...
Dungeon Exodus lies on an island south of Grey in Sosaria. You will need a boat!
Dungeon Exodus will be the death of you! Do not go there!
Go ask someone else...
Exodus...the dungeon? Or the murderous demon computer bent on the destruction of the world?
Caverns of Poseidan? Wretched place. On an island, that. West of Grey.
Can't say I've been there. Sounds dreadful.
Poseidan...yeah...I know it. Island west of Grey. Don't trust the so-called Ferryman.
Poseidan...Poseidan...I heard some Adventurers in Moon bragging about the treasure they found there.
Banished Mages? Let them stay banished, I say.
I've heard rumors of evil mage activity near the Dark Fortress in Sosaria.
If thou art banished, thou art banished for a reason. T'would be foolhardy to chase such things.
You speak of dark places, friend. What you seek lies beyond a pentagram portal in the Dark Fortress.
Glacial Scar lies in the frozen wastes of the Isles of Dread.
Glacial Scar sounds like a lovely place, but I've never been there myself.
Never heard of it.
Yeah...Isles of Dread. Big snowy island. Hard to miss.
The Fortress of the Ice Queen lies on the Frozen island of the Dread Isles.
If you seek certain death, stay thine course. To the northwest of the Dread Isles. Go prepared.
Fortress of the Ice Queen? You mean my ex-wife's house?
Scurvy Reef is underneath the Forgotten Lighthouse in the Isles of Dread.
Some say Scurvy Reef is beneath the lighthouse in the Dread Isles.
I most certainly do NOT have Scurvy...*hic*
Scurvy Reef is a dangerous place for new adventurers. Seek to improve thyself before venturing forth.
The Temple of Osirus is in the Isles of Dread.
Temple of Who? Get lost before I lose my temper.
T'would be a shame to see such a pretty face splattered across the walls of that wretched temple.
Ahh...yes. Osirus. I nearly lost my life there. Be careful. You must search the Isles of Dread.
Temple of Blood is in the Dread Isles. Search the southern point of the largest island.
Temple of Blood? As lovely a place as that sounds, I've never been there myself.
Dark magics...ill omens...you will find only despair. Look to the Dread Isles.
Bugger off, ya twat.
Saltmarsh? Damn lizards...It's in the Dread Isles.
Saltmarsh...bastion of Lizard Folk. It is in the Isles of Dread on the swampy island.
Mmm...I love Salt...*hic*...Don't really love marshes though...
You must travel through the lair of the Ancient Wyrm in the Lost Lands...the Savaged Empire.
The entrance lies past the lair of an Ancient Wyrm. Search the Lava Pools in the Savaged Empire.
Azure Castle....hmpf...Never heard of it.
The Mad Archmage? Holed up in the Savaged Empire last I heard...in the Jungle south of the Oasis.
A deadly place to be certain. Search the northern jungles of the Savaged Empire.
Sounds the sort of place I'd rather avoid, thank you kindly!
Mad...*hic*...Art mage? Whatsa...he some kinda...*hic*...painter?
The dungeon of the Lich King lies beyond the Hedge maze in the Dread Isles.
'Tis not an easy journey to the Dungeon of the Lich King. Through the hedge maze, then the crypts!
We do not speak of such evil places in the civilized world!
Forgotten Halls...this is a secret best kept.
Deep within the bowls of Britain Castle lies a dungeon of unimaginable breadth.
You ask of things better left alone. Begone.
Thy curiosity shall be the end of you.
The Catacombs of Azerok is on the Isle of the Lich in the Savaged Empire.
Azerok...that is a name I have not heard in some time. Search the Savaged Empire.
Azerok? Not a name I've heard before.
Best be on your way before things get rough.
Halls of Ogrimar can be found in the Savaged Empire in the eastern mountains.
The Halls of Ogrimar can be accessed through the Spider Cave in Savaged Empire.
Best stay away from that place. It is cursed!
*grumble* Be gone...
Ratmen? Best stay away from those filthy folk.
Ratmen Mines is in the Savaged Empire. Search the mountains to the west.
Hmm...If I had to guess, I would say Savaged Empire.
*Sputter* Good way to catch the plague runnin' 'round those mines!
Aye, I've heard of it. Savaged Empire. The west peninsula of the Oasis desert.
The Storm Giant's Lair is in the Savaged Empire. A great fortress on an island.
I almost drown trying to get there and wouldn't send you down that path. Begone!
Hmm...I'm not sure.
I have heard of this place...have you checked the Savaged Empire?
Dungeon Rock? It lies in the Savaged Empire, Search the mountains near the swamp.
That damned place...it is in the giant swamp of Savaged Empire.
Dungeon Rock? Never heard of it, friend.
Have you checked inside your butthole?
Aye, I've heard of it. I believe it is somewhere in the eastern part of the Savaged Empire.
In the lost lands. Search the swamp.
The Tombs? The far north pennisula of the Oasis desert in Savaged Empire.
Hmm...The Tombs...I believe they are to be found in the Savaged Empire.
Tombs? There are tombs everywhere in these lands. Sad times.
A tomb is where you'll end up if you keep bothering me. Begone!
You don't look like you could handle a greater hart, let alone the Tombs. Go home to mommy.
The Tower of Brass is located on the isle of Umber Veil. Many dangers lie within...prepare well.
Tower of...*hic*...ass? Sure, I'll go....*hic*
The Tower of Brass is a labrynth of deadly pitfalls. Woe be to you if you choose to journey there.
I've got two swinging pieces of brass right here, mate.
Hmm...I've heard stories of a brass tower on the island of Umber Veil.
The Mausoleum can be found on the island of Umber Veil. On the east side of the mountains.
The *hic* mouse-o-what now?
The Mausoleum is a tough place to venture into. Are you sure you are up to the challenge?
I don't know, perhaps you can ask around town?
I'm certain I heard someone talking about this...maybe another adventurer in Montor?
The Dragon's Maw, a terrible place. It can be found in the mountains of Ambrosia. Search to the west.
My best friend Sygun died in Dragon's Maw. Search the western mountains in Ambrosia for the entrance.
I heard rumors of a place with a similar name in Ambrosia.
Any place named Dragon's Maw is no place for the likes of you. Leave it to the real adventurers.
Dragon's Maw? *Glup* Sounds terrifying.
Cave of the Zulu? I think I adventured there once...in Ambrosia.
Aye, it is in Ambrosia. South west, in the mountains by a large lake.
Zulu....Zulu....not familiar...
Move along. I've better things to do than answer your questions all day.
Bother someone else.
The City of the Dead...a cursed place. It can be found in the northern mountains of Ambrosia.
Damned place...my best sword got left behind after a nast fight with a nazghoul. Ambrosia. North.
Oh, what a lovely name for a place. Let's go there immediately...for sooth.
You're better off asking someone else...places with names like that scare me.
City of the What? The dead? And you want to go there willingly? Good luck to you, sir!
The Lodoria Catacombs can be found past the Lodoria Crypts. The enrance is south of Lodoria.
The Catacombs? Dreadful place, that. You have a long trek through the Lodoria Crypts. Be safe!
I tend to stay clear of Catacombs and Crypts. You know...value my life and all that.
The Catacombs are no place for a weakling like you. Go train some more.
Try asking around, maybe someone knows. I do not.
The Lodoria Crypts? Why...in Lodoria of course.
The Crypts? In the graveyard of Lodoria. Dangerous place there. Be careful.
The Crypts...do you think you could be a bit more specific? There are crypts everywhere.
The only Crypts I've heard of are the ones in Lodoria, just south of town.
You ask me one more question, and you're going to get a boot to the arse!
The City of Embers lies in Lodoria. South of Dusk. The moongate will get you close!
That place nearly cost me my life. If you must go, go with care. To Lodoria, in the Dusk mountains.
You're asking the wrong question. The question is if I care. Get lost.
You seem like a nice person, so I'll tell you what I know...which is nothing.
I heard about the City of Embers from my Cousin. It is in the mountains near Dusk.
Covetous...the Harpy Lair. It is in Lodoria, north of Greensky.
Heard of the Golden Rangers, have you? Looking to get rich quick? Search Lodoria, near Greensky.
Heard the Harpy song, did ye? North of Greensky in Lodoria.
I wouldn't tell you if I knew!
Covet what? I don't covet nuffin'!
Harpy's will give you a mean scratch down there in Covetous. Take care. Lodoria, Greensky.
The Dungeon Deceit can be found in Lodoria in the mountains west of Glacial Hills.
Deceit. I know it well. Tucked in the mountains of Lodoria northwest of Elidor.
All manner of undead creatures in Deceit. I would advise against journeying there, friend.
You are one question away from meeting my weapon.
I am unsure. Check the local tavern. Maybe someone there knows.
I heard some adventurers in Lodoria speaking of Deceit. Perhaps you can find it there.
Dungeon Despise? Aye, in Lodoria, just east of Portshine. Try the moongate.
Despise...Despise....I Despise YOU!
Let me think on it...Oh yes! Lodoria, east of Portshine, methinks.
I overheard someone talking about Despise in the tavern. Try there.
You know what I despise? Infected. Make yourself useful and kill some of them!
Destard...lair of dragons. A deadly place for the underprepared. Northwest Lodoria.
I hope you know what you are getting into...Search the northwestern island in Lodoria.
Aye, Destard. Near Whisper in Lodoria.
Those dragons will eat you alive in seconds. You're not ready for a place like Destard.
I suggest you look to adventure someone more...appropriate for someone of your stature.
You look able bodied...to be Dragon Food! Hahahaha. Lodoria, near whisper...hahahahaha.
Aye. In Lodoria. South of Glacial Hills tucked in the mountains.
Frozen Hells is in Lodoria. In the mountains south of Glacial Hills.
Frozen Hells...no...cannot say I've been there.
Ask someone else ye lout.
Ask around...I am sure someone knows.
Hyloth...yes...In the deserts of Lodoria to be certain.
Hyloth? Hmm...I seem to remember something about a dungeon by that name in Lodoria.
Hyloth...no, sorry. Have not heard of it.
I am sure someone around here knows.
The Lizardman Cave can be found in Lodoria, south of Portshine.
That cave is held in the mountains south of Portshine. Close to the swamp.
I stay away from those animal folk. Ratmen, Lizardmen...they all terrify me.
Move along. I have no answers for thy questions.
You seek Undermountain, do you? The Lizardman Cave is only a door...you need the key.
Ravendark? We do not speak of such places here.
Places like that are better left alone for folks like us.
Cursed place. Go there at your own risk. Big, scary looking island in Lodoria.
Home to Dracula and his kin. Never had a reason to go there myself.
Castle Dracula? You want to go there? I would advise against it.
Castle Dracula...it is in Ravendark. A dangerous place for folks like us. I would stay away.
Vampire hunting, are ye? Head to Ravendark. You'll get your fill.
Go to Ravendark cemetary. His castle lies between the graveyards.
Dungeon Shame? It is found in Lodoria, through the Thunderous Halls cave.
You're looking for Thunderous Halls Cave. Southeast of Portshine tucked in the mountains.
Shame? *hic* I have none.
Haven't heard of it.
Stonegate castle...a dangerous place. Be well prepared if you wish to travel there.
Stonegate castle is cursed. The whole island is cursed. Lodoria would be better off without it!
Stonegate castle is a deadly place. Built on a mountainous island in Lodoria, it is.
Terathan Keep? In Lodoria. Nothwest of Portshine.
You have a thing for spiders? Near Portshine in Lodoria.
I went there once. Will never return.
Volcanic Caves are located in Lodoria directly southeast of Dusk. Try the moongate!
You must have a deathwish. Search the southern island of Lodoria.
I have not been there, and from the sounds of it, I never will.
Go bother someone else with your silly questions.
Dungeon Wrong, eh? In Lodoria. The mountains near Glacial Hills.
Wrong lies in Lodoria, northwest of Elidor.
Wrong? *hic* If I'm wrong...I don't want to be *hic* right!
Wrong...can't say I've heard of it.
I heard the Bone of the Frost Giant is held by a powerful giant in Glacial Scar.
Sod off.
Thou hast the countenance of a person who would be digging up old bones. Disgusting.
Frost Giant bones? Sounds like something you might find in the Glacial Scar.
The Crystal Scales...a reward for besting the denizens of Dragon's Maw in Ambrosia!
Death awaits if you continue down this path. Do not venture to Dragon's Maw. Thou are not prepared.
*Whistles*...You? In Dragon's Maw? You wouldn't survive.
Hmmm...I am not certain I know these scales you speak of. Sounds dangerous though.
The Staff of Scorn is an evil item. If you truly must have it, travel to the Dungeon Scorn.
Bugger off, ya twit.
Staff of what? Never heard of it.
The Staff of Scorn is your reward for besting the evils within the Dungeon Scorn.
The Cowl of Shadegloom is worn by an evil ghost in the Cave of Souls.
The Cave of Souls is a terrifying place for the under prepared. Go carefully, my friend.
Yeah, I have five of them in my pants. Give a reach and grab one! Har har har.
The Cave of Souls, friend.
I am busy, please ask someone else.
Urg's head can be taken right off his shoulders for all I care. Dungeon Despise.
Urg is a terrible Troll in the Dungeon Despise. He is monsterously strong!
Urg took my good eye. If you kill him, try an' get it back, will ya?
You're looking for the Dungeon Despise in Lodoria. Place smells of piss and death.
The Cinders of Life can be found in Vordo's Dungeon. Good luck finding it.
The Bottle World of Kuldar. You'll never find it, but if you do, Vordo's Dungeon.
Never heard of it.
Sod off.
The Scale of the Sea can be found in the depths of the Caverns of Poseidan.
Scale of the Sea....hmmm....never heard of it.
Scale of the Sea...yes. A cursed thing. Held by a great evil in the Caverns of Poseidan.
Bugger off.
Hmm...I heard of a giant bug in the Mines of Morinia that has such an ichor flowing through its' veins.
The inn. Ask for Pete.
Hmm...yes...the Mines of Mornia. You will find it there.
What....*hic*...Ichor of who?
The Mouth of Embers can be found in the Cave of Fire. Sosaria!
Great evils lurk in the Cave of Fire. Enter with the utmost care.
Are you barking mad? Only a fool would go to the Cave of Fire.
Not sure what you're talking about.
Lilly Pad of the Bog, you say? The Dungeon Bane holds what you seek.
Hmm...I heard about this object...perhaps the Dungeon Bane?
The Dungeon Bane...an evil place...best be wary if you plan to delve its' depths.
Get away from me, before I call the guards.
Azerok...an evil being. His Catacombs are what you seek. To the Savaged Empire!
Yes...Seek Azerok in the Catacombs of Savaged Empire.
Heard about a skull or two in my day...but Azerok? Nah. No idea.
Leave me alone.
Ink of the Deep? Aye, in the Flooded Temple.
The Flooded Temple is where you should start. Beyond that, I don't know.
Never heard of it.
Piss off.
Horn of the Frozen Hells can be found deep within the Ice Fiend Lair.
Travel to the Frozen Hells to find what you seek.
Unsure, mate.
I would rather pour salt in my eyes than talk to you for another second.
Mezlo...yes...he haunts the depths of the Mausoleum on Umber Veil island.
The Tattered Robe...I had it once...lost it gambling. Had to fight off some scamp in the Mausoleum.
You don't have the guts to stand toe to toe with Mezlo.
Not sure good sir.
Skin of the Guardian...a tough object to find. Very deadly, that dungeon. Serpent Sanctum.
Serpent Sactum. If you survive, you'll get your reward.
Can't say I've heard of that one. Sorry!
Get out of my way!
The Claw of Saramon is the prize for besting Dungeon Hyloth in Lodoria.
Dungeon Hyloth, friend.
Thine intentions t'would not be aligned with sense if you venture to Dungeon Hyloth with armor like that.
Can't be bothered, mate. Off to see the dentist.
Eye of Plagues. The great dragon of Terathan keep holds your prize.
If it's a fight you're looking for, you'll certainly find it in Terathan Keep. And the eye.
Those spiders would tear you to shreds. Western Lodoria. Terathan Keep.
You're better off staying home.
The Orb is held by the wizard in a dungeon that shares his name. The Tomb of the Fallen Wizard.
Stay out of that tomb! It is cursed!
The Tomb of the Fallen Wizard. A terrible place, and a terrible end to you if you go there.
Bugger off.
A terrible evil haunts the Lodoria Catacombs. You must go through the crypts!
Evil lurks in the Lodoria Crypts...even darker things in the Catacombs that follow!
Try Lodoria...the Catacombs.
Sod off, git.
His Brandy? Hah! You couldn't sniff at his trousers without passing out from fear!
If you're certain you want to die, seek the Undersea Castle.
The Undersea Castle. Go with care.
I just want to take a nap...
That Lamp is cursed! But if you want it, be my guest. It is in the Tombs of Kazibal.
The Tombs of Kazibal. A wretched place, so go well prepared.
Lamp of the what? Are you a crazy person?
I have nothing to say to you.
Aye, yes...the Wand of Talosh is held by a terrifying Lich in the depths of the Dungeon Deceit.
The Dungeon Deceit is crawling with undead things. Be warned...do not go there!
The wand of Who?
You speak of evil things. Begone!
The Hair of the Earth can be found in the Halls of Undermountain.
Hair of the Earth, you say? I heard rumors that it lies deep in the Halls of Undermountain.
Hmm...haven't heard of it.
Leave me be...I'm busy.
Hmm...yes...Scarthis's Scale. It can be taken from him, once bested. The Sanctum of Saltmarsh.
Scarthis resides in the Sanctum of Saltmarsh. Hoards of terrible lizardmen. Go with care!
Not sure...
If you go searching for such an object, you will surely die.
The Branch of the Reaper is found deep within the Dungeon Wrath.
The Dungeon Wrath...go with care...tis a deadly place.
The Dungeon Wrath is no place for a weakling like you!
Hmm...I am not certain. Maybe try another town? Or the tavern?
Vampire Teeth? Are you insane? You know they are inside the mouth of a vampire, right?
Yes...Below Castle Dracula, in the crypts. This is not a place for the faint of heart.
I don't know much, but I know not to go chasing Vampires and pulling out their teeth,
The Castle Dracula. Be warned, this is a very dangerous place. You must be well prepared.
The Jade Idol of Nesfatiti is an ancient relic held by the Mad Archmage. Find him in his Dungeon.
The Dungeon of the Mad Archmage. It is a terrible place with many dangers. Go with care.
Never had much use for idols...I am a God fearing man.
Sod off. I'm in a foul mood.
The cursed mind of a Queen Succubus in the Dungeon Torment. She will not part with it easily.
The Dungeon Torment. Stay away if you want to live.
Hmm...I lost my mind long ago...what makes you think I keep track of someone elses?
Be gone. You speak of things better left uncovered.
The Whip from Below can be found at the bottom of Dungeon Exodus.
Deep within the Castle Exodus in Sosaria. Look for an island to the west.
I'm busy...check with someone else.
The Mind of Silver can be found in the Temple of Osirius.
A terrible mind from a terrible place. The Temple of Osirius.
Hmm...I am not sure. Ask around at the Inn.
Not today friend, I am tired and under paid.
The Stump of the Ancients...yes...Dardin's Pit. It must be cut from the monsterous Ent who reigns there.
Aye. Dardin's Pit. In Sosaria.
What did you call me?
If it's ancient, probably in a dungeon.
The Hourglass of Ages can be found at the bottom of Time Awaits in Sosaria.
Yes...a beautiful object. The last I heard it was somewhere in the Dungeon of Time Awaits.
What is an hourglass? We are simple folk around here, stay away with your hocus pocus.
Sounds valuable...if you ever find it come to me. I'll give you a good price!
You can find the Mask of the Ghost in the dungeon Vile.
The Dungeon Vile. It is a deadly place, so be prepared if you intend to traverse its' depths.
Ghosts? Masks? I fear both and have no knowledge of what you seek.
I think I'm going to be sick...*Vomits*
The Heart of Ash can be found within Stonegate Castle. An extremely dangerous place. Not for the weak.
Search Stonegate Castle. Be ye warned, this is a difficult place to survive. Be well prepared.
You honestly would not last long in Stonegate Castle. Try for some lower hanging fruit.
I'm not on the clock. Go bother someone else.
An evil, sentient swarm of insects found in the Dungeon Wicked.
Yes...they can be found deep within the Dungeon Wicked.
Sounds horrible. Why would you actively look for something like that?
Lot's of dead flies around town. Venom Flies? Not sure about them...
The Urn of Ulmarek can be found in the Forgotten Halls.
Deep within the Forgotten Halls. But this is a deadly place and should be avoided by someone like you.
You are not prepared, do not ask me again.
Get lost.
The Mystical Wax is rumored to be in the Black Knights Valut.
I heard rumors that this object can be found in the massive vault of the Black Knight.
The Black Knight's Vault. But be warned...this is a very dangerous place.
Saramak has been held in the Ancient Prison for centuries. He still wears his shackles.
You can find Saramak in the Ancient Prison. If you don't have the key for his shackles, just take his hands.
Hmm...I believe he is still being held in the Ancient Prison for his many crimes.
Saramak...he still owes me 15,000 gold. He's in prison. The Ancient Prison.
The Pearl of Neptune...a beautiful trinket...it can be found in the Scurvy Reef.
Scurvy Reef. Be careful if you venture there. It is a difficult place with many dangers.
Hmm...Pearls...Would I be in this horrible town if I knew where to find pearls?
Thou must rip it from the corpse of a powerful Lich in the Ancient Pyramid.
Aye...the Ancient Pyramid in Sosaria.
Suffering? Thou dost not know suffering unless you've had my wife's cooking!
In the Dungeon Hate. A terrible place. Be warned.
The Immortal Bones can be found in the Dungeon Hate.
Right here in my pants.
The Scroll of Abraxus. A powerful relic. Search The Tombs. You'll find it there.
Some things are better left unfound, friend.
Go to The Tombs. You will find it there amongst the evils that lurk in the shadows.
The Sphere of the Dark Circle is an evil item held by the Lich King. Search his dungeon.
The Dungeon of the Lich King. A terrifying place with many evils. Be careful if you search there!
Perhaps an easier dungeon is more fitting for one such as yourself. The Lich King would end your life.
The Stone of the Night gargoyle can be found in Dungeon Rock.
The lair of gargoyles....Dungeon Rock. It can be found in the Savaged Empire.
Gargoyles? Stay away from them, myself.
The Dungeon Shame. A dangerous place if you are untrained.
Elemental Salt is my secret ingrediant! I'm not telling you where it is!
Dungeon Shame, my friend.
The Azure Dust can be found in the Azure Castle...duh.
The Azure Castle. Not an easy place to find, mind you. I bid thee good luck!
Azure Castle is no place for someone like you. Do not go there.
Ask someone else. I do not know.
The Dark Blood can be found in the Dungeon Abandon. You must slay the Blood Elemental.
Dark Blood. *Shudders* A powerful elemental bleeds the darkest blood...in Dungeon Abandon.
Thou speakest of dark magics and things unbecoming of an upstanding citizen.
The Bleeding Crystal can be found in the Blood Temple.
Turlox is a great evil that lurks in the Volcanic Cave.
The Skull of Turlox can be found in the Volcanic Cave.
Be gone.
The Braclet of War is worn by the master of Dungeon Clues.
The Dungeon Clues. It is filled with all manner of brigands and thieves. Watch your packs!
A clue for thee. Clues, 'tis your clue.
The Blood of the Forrest can be found in the Tower of Brass.
The Tower of Brass. A giant labrynth. Be well prepared if you plan on adventuring there.
On the Isle of Umber Veil is the Brass Tower. A dungeon of unimaginable depth. Search there.
The Wedding Dress of Virtue...a valuable artifact. It can be found in the Dungeon Ankh.
The Dungeon Ankh. Search there, friend.
No virtuous maidens in these lands as far as I can tell. Forever alone...
Jetson? He's the best looking guy in the world!
Jetson? He's the best. I love that guy.
Jetson? What a guy...I mean...hes just really great.
Jetson? I heard he can lift ten times his body weight!
Jetson? The best lute player in the lands!
Jetson? I heard he has more gold than sand in the seas!
Jetson? Only the greatest adventurer of all time!
Jetson? He makes the Dark Father look like a pussy cat!
Dramuloux...the shadow dragon. In the depths of Dungeon Destard.
The great shadow dragon Damulox and his flame can be found in the Dungeon Destard.
Dramulox? The great shadow dragon? If you try to take his flame, you will be eaten!
The Crystal of Everfrost is the prized posession of a powerful golem in the Ice Queen's Fortress.
The Cystal of Everfrost...I think that is in the Ice Queens Frotress.
The Amulet of the Stygian Abyss can be found in the Gargoyle Crypts.
Search the Gargoyle Crypts.
Leave me be...I'm tired.
The Firescale tooth can be found in the Fires of Hell. Sosaria.
A giant drake in the bowels of Fires of Hell holds the Firescale tooth.
The Crown of Vorgol can be found in the City of Embers.
Lodoria...the City of Embers.
Most reagents can be bought from Alchemists, Herbalists, or Mages. You can also find them on slain monsters.
Seek a Guildmaster! There is a small fee for joining a guild, that increases each time you join a new guild!
The Guildmaster of the Tailors guild was living in Montor last I heard!
I saw him at the Britain Blacksmith's shop when I was shopping for a new sword.
The Druid's guild is headquartered in Montor. You will find their Guildmaster there. Just east of the bridge.
Powerscrolls are magical items that allow you to exceed the Grandmaster level of a skill!
Powerscrolls are found on some very powerful monsters, or purchased from vendors.
The Jedi, eh? There are a few milling around the lands...I ran into one in the Savaged Empire. To the south.
The Sith? They are all dead. Good riddance, I say. You can find proof at the bottom of the Fires of Hell.
Legend has it that Mangar the Dark sealed off Skara Brae . His tower is north of Montor.
Dragons? Scary beasts. Try the Dungeon Destard. There are weaker ones in Dragon's Maw.
Search the Caverns of Poseidan for a book that will show you the way to Lodoria. You will need a boat!
Umber Veil can be reached by a magical gate on the northern most island in Sosaria.
Ambrosia can be reached by a magical gate on the Isle of Fire. Just southeast of Castle Exodus.
Ancient Wyverns...some of the most powerful beasts in the land...they make wonderful pets! Dungeon Destard!
Mammoths make great pets. You should try taming some. Look on the frozen islands in Sosaria!
Search the ruins of Skara Brae for the key to the underworld. Take it to the Underworld gate!
Powerscrolls must be used in order. 105, 110, 115, 120, 125. They are used at shrines in Ambrosia.
After some basic training, try the Magma Vaults, Dardin's Pit or Perinian depths. But don't go too deep!
You must be maximum fame and karma and have 20,000 gold to trade for a legendary artifact.
There are many temples in the lands, but one can be found in Sosaria near the Fires of Hell.
For requirements say LA requirements. For Temple locations, say LA temple. For info say LA info.
Legendary Artifacts start as mundane items and grow in power as you use them. Try using oils on them!
M'lord, Darkmoor is a place of pure evil! Once a beautiful land, curroupted by an unspeakable evil!
There is rumor that a stranger in Lamut may know more about Darkmoor
I have heard of many evil beings residing in Darkmoor, go speak to the stranger in Lamut
The time lord awaits... who knows what, Sire!
The balance between order and chaos rules all things.
Aye, It influences all lands, which in turn affects the dangers within
There is a sigil in the bank placed there long ago
The balance?! Yes, I've heard of it... but I don't speak about it out loud!
Avatars are the heroes of the lands, fighting for the everpresent balance
Avatars are much more powerful than ordinary adventurers... they learn faster, and hit harder!
I wish I were an avatar, in all honesty
The balance is influenced by the actions of Avatars, it seeks to return to a neutral state if the avatars excert too much pressure upon it!
Avatars get great boons if the balance is leaning towards their chosen side
Art thou saying there are lands where items dissapear magically without reason? That's horrible!
Its told that there is a magic school called sorcery... where adventurers can reach powers not seen before!
Some say you can become an sorcerer by what you choose to wear... there is a book which explains this, but i've not seen it!
More powerful than mere magic, or so I am told, seek a book which hints how to become one!
Aye, troubadours are adventurers who have devoted their lives to the art of the song!
When one specializes in the way of the troubadour, one can control untold powers! Seek a book which explains how to become one
I'm told there is a book which details and hints how to become a troubadour...
